comments:
When displaying a blocking dialog after another blocking dialog has been closed, sometimes an exception is thrown (which doesn't seem to have an impact on the application's behaviour).
This seems to be indeterministic and even the stack trace differs.

Two examples:
java.lang.IllegalStateException: The context has been disposed.
	at org.eclipse.rwt.internal.service.ServiceContext.checkState(ServiceContext.java:154)
	at org.eclipse.rwt.internal.service.ServiceContext.getStateInfo(ServiceContext.java:104)

	at org.eclipse.rwt.internal.lifecycle.Render.execute(Render.java:28)

We encountered a similar problem, but more deterministic.

While trying to show a further blocking dialog (using Dialog.open()) after a previously displayed blocking dialog was closed, the following exception occurs:

org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Invalid thread access
